intro: Xylopia setosa, commonly known as the slender xylopia, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its aromatic, rough, and often branching stems. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences, followed by woody capsules containing numerous seeds. Xylopia setosa is known for its medicinal properties, with various parts of the plant used in traditional remedies. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and ethnobotanical contexts.
